text: In the thirtieth year, in the fourth month, on the fifth day of the month, as I was among the captives by the river of Kebar, the heavens were opened and I saw visions of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the fifth day of the month, which was the fifth year of the captivity of King Jehoiachin,
speaker: Narrator

text: the word of the Lord came expressly to Ezekiel the priest, the son of Buzi, in the land of the Chaldeans by the River Kebar. And the hand of the Lord was on him there.
speaker: Narrator

text: As I looked, a whirlwind came out of the north, a great cloud with fire flashing forth continually, and a brightness was all around it, and in its midst something as glowing metal in the midst of the fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also out of the midst came the likeness of four living creatures. And this was their appearance: They had the likeness of a man.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every one had four faces, and every one had four wings.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their legs were straight and the soles of their feet were like the sole of a calf’s hoof. And they gleamed like the color of burnished bronze.
speaker: Narrator

text: They had the hands of a man under their wings on their four sides. As for the faces and wings of the four of them,
speaker: Narrator

text: their wings were joined to one another. Their faces did not turn when they went. Each went straight forward.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for the likeness of their faces, each had the face of a man, and all four had the face of a lion on the right side, and the face of an ox on the left side, and the face of an eagle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus were their faces. And their wings were stretched upward. Two wings of every one were joined to one another, and two covered their bodies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Each went straight forward. Wherever the spirit was to go, they would go and not turn as they went.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for the likeness of the living creatures, their appearance was like burning coals of fire and like the appearance of lamps. It went up and down among the living creatures. And the fire was bright, and out of the fire went forth lightning.
speaker: Narrator

text: The living creatures ran to and fro as the appearance of a flash of lightning.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now as I looked at the living creatures, one wheel was on the ground by the living creatures for each of the four faces.
speaker: Narrator

text: The appearance of the wheels and their work was like the color of sparkling beryl. And all four of them had one likeness. And their appearance and their work was, as it were, a wheel in the middle of a wheel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whenever they went, they went in any of their four sides and did not turn as they went.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for their rims, they were so high that they were dreadful. And the rims of all four of them were full of eyes all around.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whenever the living creatures went, the wheels went with them. And whenever the living creatures were lifted up from the ground, the wheels also were lifted up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherever the spirit was about to go, they would go in that direction. And the wheels rose close beside them. For the spirit of the living creatures was in the wheels.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whenever those went, these went. And whenever those stood still, these stood still. And whenever those rose from the ground, the wheels rose close beside them. For the spirit of the living creatures was in the wheels.
speaker: Narrator

text: The likeness of the expanse over the heads of the living creatures was as the awesome gleam of crystal, stretched out over their heads above.
speaker: Narrator

text: Under the expanse their wings were stretched out straight, the one toward the other. Each one also had two wings which covered its body on the one side and the other.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they went, I heard the noise of their wings, like the noise of abundant waters, as the voice of the Almighty, the noise of tumult as the noise of an army camp. Whenever they stood still, they let down their wings.
speaker: Narrator

text: There was a voice from the expanse that was over their heads whenever they stood still and let down their wings.
speaker: Narrator

text: Above the expanse that was over their heads was the likeness of a throne, as the appearance of a sapphire stone. And on the likeness of the throne was the likeness as the appearance of a man on it high up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I saw as glowing metal, as the appearance of fire all around within it, from the appearance of His loins and upward; and from the appearance of His loins and downward I saw as it were the appearance of fire, and there was a brightness around Him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As the appearance of the rainbow that is in the cloud on a day of rain, so was the appearance of the brightness all around.
This was the appearance of the likeness of the glory of the Lord. And when I saw it, I fell on my face and heard a voice of one speaking.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He said to me: Son of man, stand on your feet, and I will speak to you!
speaker: Narrator

text: When He spoke to me, the Spirit entered me and set me on my feet. Then I heard Him speaking to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to me: Son of man, I send you to the sons of Israel, to a rebellious nation that has rebelled against Me. They and their fathers have transgressed against Me even to this very day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as for the impudent and obstinate children, I am sending you to them. And you shall say to them, “Thus says the Lord God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As for them, whether they listen or not (for they are a rebellious house), they shall know that there has been a prophet among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you, son of man, do not be afraid of them or be afraid of their words, though briers and thorns be with you, and you dwell among scorpions. Do not be afraid of their words or be dismayed at their looks, for they are a rebellious house.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall speak My words to them, whether they listen or not, for they are rebellious.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you, son of man, hear what I say to you. Do not be rebellious like that rebellious house. Open your mouth and eat what I give you.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I looked, a hand was sent to me. And a scroll was in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He spread it before me. And there was writing on the inside and on the outside, and written on it were words of lamentation and mourning and woe.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover He said to me, Son of man, eat what you find. Eat this scroll and go speak to the house of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I opened my mouth, and He fed me this scroll.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to me, Son of man, feed your stomach and fill your inward parts with this scroll that I give you. Then I ate it, and it was as honey for sweetness in my mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He said to me: Son of man, go to the house of Israel and speak with My words to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you are not being sent to a people of foreign speech and hard language, but to the house of Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: nor to many peoples of foreign speech and hard language, whose words you cannot understand. But I have sent you to them who should listen to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the house of Israel will not listen to you, because they will not listen to Me. For all the house of Israel is impudent and obstinate.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I have made your face as hard as their faces and your forehead as hard as their foreheads.
speaker: Narrator

text: As emery harder than flint, I have made your forehead. Do not be afraid of them or be dismayed at their looks, though they are a rebellious house.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover He said to me: Son of man, all My words that I shall speak to you receive in your heart and hear with your ears.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go to the captives, to the sons of your people, and speak to them and tell them, whether they listen or not, “Thus says the Lord God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Spirit took me up, and I heard behind me a great thundering voice: “Blessed be the glory of the Lord in His place.”
speaker: Narrator

text: I heard also the noise of the wings of the living creatures that touched one another and the noise of the wheels beside them, even a great rushing sound.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Spirit lifted me up and took me away, and I went in bitterness, in the heat of my spirit, and the hand of the Lord was strong upon me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I came to the captives at Tel Aviv, who lived by the River Kebar, and I sat there where they sat seven days, causing consternation among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the end of seven days, the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Son of man, I have made you a watchman to the house of Israel. Whenever you hear the word from My mouth, then warn them from Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I say to the wicked, “You shall surely die,” and you do not warn him, nor speak to warn the wicked from his wicked way that he may live, the same wicked man shall die in his iniquity, but his blood I will require at your hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet if you warn the wicked and he does not turn from his wickedness or from his wicked way, he shall die in his iniquity. But you have delivered your soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again, when a righteous man turns from his righteousness and commits iniquity, and I lay a stumbling block before him, he shall die. Because you have not given him warning, he shall die in his sin, and his righteousness which he has done shall not be remembered. But his blood I will require at your hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless if you warn the righteous man that the righteous should not sin and he does not sin, he shall surely live because he took warning. And you have delivered your soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: The hand of the Lord was upon me there, and He said to me, Rise, go out into the plain, and I will talk with you there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I arose, and went out into the plain. And the glory of the Lord stood there, as the glory which I saw by the river of Kebar, and I fell on my face.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Spirit entered me, and set me on my feet, and spoke with me and said to me: Go, shut yourself up within your house.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for you, son of man, they shall put bands on you and shall bind you with them, so that you cannot go out among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will make your tongue cleave to the roof of your mouth so that you shall be mute and cannot be one to rebuke them, for they are a rebellious house.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when I speak with you, I will open your mouth, and you shall say to them, “Thus says the Lord God.” He who hears, let him hear. And he who refuses, let him refuse. For they are a rebellious house.
speaker: Narrator

text: You also, son of man, take a brick and lay it before you and inscribe a city on it, even Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then lay siege against it, and build a fort against it, and build a mound against it; set camps and place battering rams against it all around.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover take for yourself an iron plate and set it up for a wall of iron between you and the city. And set your face against it so that it is besieged, and lay siege against it. This shall be a sign to the house of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for you, lie down on your left side and lay the iniquity of the house of Israel upon it. According to the number of the days that you lie on it, you shall bear their iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have laid upon you the years of their iniquity according to the number of the days, three hundred and ninety days. So you shall bear the iniquity of the house of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you have accomplished them, lie again on your right side, and you shall bear the iniquity of the house of Judah forty days. I have appointed you each day for a year.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore you shall set your face toward the siege of Jerusalem, and your arm shall be uncovered, and you shall prophesy against it.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will lay bands upon you, and you shall not turn yourself from one side to another until you have ended the days of your siege.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also take for yourself wheat, and barley, and beans, and lentils, and millet, and spelt, and put them in one vessel and make bread. According to the number of the days that you lie on your side, three hundred and ninety days, you shall eat it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your food which you shall eat shall be by weight, twenty shekels a day. From time to time you shall eat it.
speaker: Narrator

text: You also shall drink water by measure, the sixth part of a hin. From time to time you shall drink it.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall eat it as barley cake, having baked it in their sight with dung that comes out of man.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said, “Even so the sons of Israel shall eat their defiled bread among the nations where I drive them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I said, “Ah, Lord God! My soul has not been defiled. For from my youth up even until now I have not eaten of that which dies of itself, or is torn in pieces, nor has abominable meat come into my mouth.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He said to me, “I have given you cow dung instead of man’s dung over which you shall prepare your bread.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover He said to me, Son of man, I will cut off the supply of bread in Jerusalem. They shall eat bread by weight and with anxiety and drink water by measure and with horror,
speaker: Narrator

text: because bread and water will be scarce, and they will be appalled with one another, and waste away for their iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for you, son of man, take a sharp sword. Take and cause it to pass upon your head and upon your beard as a barber’s razor. Then take balances to weigh and divide the hair.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall burn with fire a third part in the midst of the city when the days of the siege are fulfilled. Then you shall take a third part and strike it with the sword all around the city. And a third part you shall scatter in the wind. And I will draw out a sword after them.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall also take a few in number from them and bind them in the edges of your robes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then take some of them again and cast them into the midst of the fire and burn them in the fire. For a fire shall come out into all the house of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus says the Lord God: This is Jerusalem. I have set it in the midst of the nations, with countries that are all around her.
speaker: Narrator

text: But she has rebelled against My judgments more wickedly than the nations, and against My statutes more than the countries that are all around her. For they have refused My judgments and My statutes, and have not walked in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus says the Lord God: Because you have more turmoil than the nations that are round about you and have not walked in My statutes, or have kept My judgments, and have not even acted according to the judgments of the nations that are all around you,
speaker: Narrator

text: therefore thus says the Lord God: Pay attention. I, even I, am against you and will execute judgments in your midst in the sight of the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will do in you what I have not done, and the like of which I will not do anymore, because of all your abominations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the fathers shall eat their sons in your midst, and the sons shall eat their fathers. For I will execute judgments on you, and the whole remnant of you I will scatter into all the winds.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, as I live, says the Lord God, surely, because you have defiled My sanctuary with all your detestable things and with all your abominations, therefore I will also diminish you, and My eye shall have no pity, nor will I spare.
speaker: Narrator

text: A third part of you shall die by pestilence or by famine; they shall be consumed in your midst. And a third part shall fall by the sword all around you. And I will scatter a third part into all the winds, and I will draw out a sword after them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus My anger shall be accomplished, and I will cause My fury to rest upon them, and I will be comforted. Then they shall know that I the Lord have spoken it in My zeal when I have accomplished My fury in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover I will make you a desolation and a reproach among the nations that are all around you, in the sight of all who pass by.
speaker: Narrator

text: So it shall be a reproach and a taunt, a warning and an astonishment to the nations that are all around you, when I execute judgments in you in anger and in fury and in furious rebukes. I the Lord have spoken it.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I send upon them the deadly arrows of famine which shall be for their destruction and which I will send to destroy you, then I will also increase the famine upon you and break your staff of bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I will send upon you famine and wild beasts, and they shall bereave you of children. And pestilence and bloodshed shall pass through you. And I will bring the sword upon you. I the Lord have spoken it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Son of man, set your face toward the mountains of Israel, and prophesy against them,
speaker: Narrator

text: and say, Mountains of Israel, hear the word of the Lord God. Thus says the Lord God to the mountains, and to the hills, to the rivers, and to the valleys: Pay attention. I, even I, will bring a sword upon you, and I will destroy your high places.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your altars shall be desolate, and your images shall be broken. And I will cast down your slain men before your idols.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will lay the dead corpses of the sons of Israel before their idols. And I will scatter your bones all around your altars.
speaker: Narrator

text: In all your dwelling places, the cities shall be laid waste and the high places shall be desolate so that your altars may be laid waste and made desolate, and your idols may be broken and cease, and your images may be cut down, and your works may be abolished.
speaker: Narrator

text: The slain shall fall in your midst, and you shall know that I am the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet I will leave a remnant, for you will have some who escape the sword among the nations when you are scattered among the countries.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those of you who escape shall remember Me among the nations wherever they shall be carried captive, because I am broken by their whorish heart which has departed from Me, and with their eyes which play the harlot after their idols. And they shall loathe themselves for the evils which they have committed in all their abominations.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall know that I am the Lord, and that I have not said in vain that I would bring this calamity upon them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus says the Lord God: Clap your hand, and stamp with your foot, and say, Alas for all the evil abominations of the house of Israel! For they shall fall by sword, by famine, and by pestilence.
speaker: Narrator

text: He who is far off shall die of pestilence, and he who is near shall fall by the sword, and he who remains and is besieged shall die by famine. Thus I will accomplish My fury upon them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you shall know that I am the Lord, when their slain men shall be among their idols all around their altars, on every high hill, in all the tops of the mountains, and under every green tree, and under every thick oak, the place where they offered sweet savor to all their idols.
speaker: Narrator

text: So, in all their habitations I will stretch out My hand upon them and make the land desolate, indeed, more desolate than the wilderness toward Diblah. And they shall know that I am the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover the word of the Lord came to me, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text:
And you, son of man, thus says the Lord God to the land of Israel:
An end, the end is coming
    upon the four corners of the land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now the end has come upon you,
    and I will send My anger upon you,
and will judge you according to your ways,
    and will recompense upon you all your abominations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My eye shall not spare you,
    nor will I have pity;
but I will recompense your ways upon you,
    and your abominations shall be in your midst.
And you shall know that I am the Lord!
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Your doom has come to you,
    O inhabitant in the land;
the time has come, the day of trouble is near,
    and not the joyful shouting on the mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now I will shortly pour out My fury upon you,
    and accomplish My anger upon you;
and I will judge you according to your ways,
    and will recompense you for all your abominations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My eye shall not spare,
    nor will I have pity;
I will recompense you according to your ways,
    and your abominations that are in your midst.
And you shall know that I am the Lord who strikes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The day is coming!
    Your doom has gone out;
the rod has blossomed,
    pride has budded.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Violence has risen up
    into a rod of wickedness;
none of them shall remain,
    none of their people,
none of their wealth,
    nor anything eminent among them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The time has come,
    the day has drawn near.
Do not let the buyer rejoice,
    or the seller mourn,
    for wrath is against all their multitude.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the seller shall not return
    to that which is sold,
    although they both live;
for the vision concerning the whole multitude
    shall not return;
nor shall any strengthen his life
    by his iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have blown the trumpet
    even to make all ready,
but none goes to the battle;
    for My wrath is against all the multitude.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sword is outside,
    and the pestilence and the famine within.
He who is in the field
    shall die by the sword;
and he who is in the city,
    famine and pestilence shall devour him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even when their survivors escape,
    they shall be on the mountains
like doves of the valleys,
    all of them mourning,
    every one over his iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All hands shall be feeble,
    and all knees shall be weak as water.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They shall also gird themselves with sackcloth,
    and horror shall cover them;
and shame shall be upon all faces,
    and baldness upon all their heads.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They shall cast their silver in the streets,
    and their gold shall become abhorrent;
their silver and their gold
    shall not be able to deliver them
    in the day of the wrath of the Lord;
they shall not satisfy their souls,
    or fill their stomachs,
    for their iniquity has become a stumbling block.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They transformed the beauty of His ornaments into pride,
    and made the images of their abominations
and of their detestable things with it;
    therefore I will make it an abhorrent thing to them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will give it into the hands of the strangers
    as plunder and to the wicked of the earth for destruction,
    and they shall pollute it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My face also I will turn from them,
    and they shall pollute My secret place;
for the robbers shall enter
    and defile it.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Therefore I will bring the worst of the nations,
    and they shall possess their houses;
I will also make the pomp of the strong to cease,
    and their holy places shall be defiled.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When destruction comes,
    then they shall seek peace, but there shall be none.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Mischief shall come upon mischief,
    and rumor shall be upon rumor.
Then they shall seek a vision of the prophet;
    but the law shall perish from the priest,
    and counsel from the elders.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The king shall mourn,
    and the prince shall be clothed with desolation,
    and the hands of the people of the land shall tremble.
I will do to them according to their way,
    and according to what they deserve I will judge them.
And they shall know that I am the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text: In the sixth year, in the sixth month, on the fifth day of the month, as I sat in my house and the elders of Judah sat before me, the hand of the Lord God fell upon me there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I looked, and there was a likeness as the appearance of a man. From His loins and downward was the appearance of fire. And from His loins and upward was the appearance of brightness, as the appearance of glowing metal.
speaker: Narrator

text: He stretched out the form of a hand and took me by a lock of my head. And the Spirit lifted me up between the earth and the heavens, and brought me in the visions of God to Jerusalem, to the entrance of the north gate of the inner court, where the seat of the image of jealousy was, which provokes to jealousy.
speaker: Narrator

text: The glory of the God of Israel was there, according to the vision that I saw in the plain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He said to me, “Son of man, lift up your eyes now toward the north.” So I lifted up my eyes toward the north, and northward at the gate of the altar was this image of jealousy in the entrance.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said furthermore to me, “Son of man, do you see what they do, even the great abominations that the house of Israel commits here, so that I should go far off from My sanctuary? But yet you shall see still greater abominations.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He brought me to the door of the court. And when I looked, there was a hole in the wall.
speaker: Narrator

text: So He said to me, “Son of man, now dig in the wall.” And when I had dug in the wall, there was a door.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to me, “Enter and notice the wicked abominations that they do here.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So I went in and saw every form of creeping things, and abominable beasts, and all the idols of the house of Israel, portrayed upon the wall all around.
speaker: Narrator

text: There stood before them seventy men of the elders of the house of Israel, and in their midst stood Jaazaniah the son of Shaphan, with every man his censer in his hand, and a thick cloud of incense went up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He said to me, “Son of man, have you seen what the elders of the house of Israel do in the dark, every man in the chambers of his images? For they say, ‘The Lord does not see us. The Lord has forsaken the land.’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text: He also said to me, “Yet again you shall see greater abominations that they do.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He brought me to the door of the gate of the house of the Lord which was toward the north. And women sat there weeping for Tammuz.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He said to me, “Have you seen this, O son of man? Yet again you shall see greater abominations than these.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He brought me into the inner court of the house of the Lord, and at the door of the temple of the Lord, between the porch and the altar, were about twenty-five men with their backs toward the temple of the Lord and their faces toward the east. And they worshipped the sun toward the east.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He said to me, “Have you seen this, O son of man? Is it a light thing to the house of Judah that they commit the abominations which they commit here? For they have filled the land with violence and have continually provoked Me to anger. And they put the branch to their nose.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I will indeed deal in fury. My eye shall not spare, nor will I have pity. And though they cry in My ears with a loud voice, yet I will not listen to them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He cried out also in my ears with a loud voice, saying, “Cause those who have charge over the city to draw near, even every man with his destroying weapon in his hand.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Six men came from the way of the higher gate which lies toward the north, each with his battle weapon in his hand. And one man among them was clothed with linen with a writer’s case by his side. And they went in and stood beside the bronze altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the glory of the God of Israel ascended from the cherub on which it had been, to the threshold of the temple. And He called to the man clothed with linen who had the writer’s case by his side.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said to him, “Go through the midst of the city, through the midst of Jerusalem, and set a mark upon the foreheads of the men who sigh and groan for all the abominations that are done in its midst.”
speaker: Narrator

text: To the others He said in my hearing, “Go after him through the city and strike. Do not let your eye spare or have pity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Utterly slay old and young, both maidens and little children, and women. But do not touch any man on whom is the mark. And begin at My sanctuary.” Then they began with the elders who were before the temple.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said to them, “Defile the temple, and fill the courts with the slain. Go forth!” So they went out and killed in the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: While they were killing, I was left alone; and I fell on my face and cried out, “Ah, Lord God! Will You destroy all the rest of Israel by Your pouring out of Your fury upon Jerusalem?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He said to me, “The iniquity of the house of Israel and Judah is exceedingly great, and the land is full of blood, and the city is full of perverseness. For they say, ‘The Lord has forsaken the land, and the Lord does not see.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for Me, My eye shall not spare, nor will I have pity, but I will recompense their way upon their heads.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the man clothed with linen who had the case by his side reported the matter, saying, “I have done just as You have commanded me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I looked, and in the expanse that was above the heads of the cherubim there appeared over them, as it were, a sapphire stone, as the appearance of the likeness of a throne.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He spoke to the man clothed with linen and said, “Go in between the wheels under the cherubim and fill your hands with coals of fire from among the cherubim and scatter them over the city.” And he entered in my sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the cherubim stood on the right side of the temple when the man went in, and the cloud filled the inner court.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the glory of the Lord went up from the cherub and stood over the threshold of the temple. And the house was filled with the cloud, and the court was full of the brightness of the glory of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sound of the wings of the cherubim was heard even in the outer court, like the voice of the Almighty God when He speaks.
speaker: Narrator

text: When He had commanded the man clothed with linen, saying, “Take fire from between the wheels, from among the cherubim,” he went in and stood beside the wheel.
speaker: Narrator

text: One cherub stretched out his hand from among the cherubim to the fire that was between the cherubs, and took some, and put it into the hands of him who was clothed with linen, who took it and went out.
speaker: Narrator

text: There appeared among the cherubim the form of a man’s hand under their wings.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I looked, and there were the four wheels by the cherubim, one wheel by one cherub, and another wheel by another cherub. And the appearance of the wheels was as the color of a beryl stone.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for their appearances, all four had one likeness, as if one wheel had been in the middle of a wheel.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they went, they went on their four sides. They did not turn as they went, but they followed to the place wherever the head looked. They did not turn as they went.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their whole body, and their backs, and their hands, and their wings, and the wheels that the four had were full of eyes all round.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for the wheels, they were called in my hearing the whirling wheels.
speaker: Narrator

text: Each one had four faces. The first face was the face of a cherub, the second face was the face of a man, the third the face of a lion, and the fourth the face of an eagle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the cherubim rose up. They are the living creatures that I saw by the River Kebar.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the cherubim went, the wheels went by them. And when the cherubim lifted up their wings to mount up from the earth, the same wheels also would not turn from beside them.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the cherubim stood, the wheels stood. And when they rose up, the wheels also rose up with them. For the spirit of the living creatures was in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the glory of the Lord departed from off the threshold of the temple and stood over the cherubim.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cherubim lifted up their wings and mounted up from the earth in my sight. When they went out, the wheels were beside them. They stood at the door of the east gate of the house of the Lord; and the glory of the God of Israel was above them.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the living creatures that I saw under the God of Israel by the River Kebar. So I knew that they were cherubim.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every one had four faces apiece, and every one four wings. And the likeness of the hands of a man was under their wings.
speaker: Narrator

text: The likeness of their faces was the same faces which I saw by the River Kebar, their appearances and themselves. Each went straight forward.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover the Spirit lifted me up and brought me to the east gate of the house of the Lord which faces eastward. And at the door of the gate were twenty-five men, among whom I saw Jaazaniah the son of Azzur and Pelatiah the son of Benaiah, officials of the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He said to me, “Son of man, these are the men who devise mischief and give wicked counsel in this city,
speaker: Narrator

text: who say, ‘The time is not near to build houses. This city is the cauldron, and we are the flesh.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore prophesy against them; prophesy, son of man!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Spirit of the Lord fell upon me, and He said to me, Say, Thus says the Lord: Thus you have said, O house of Israel, for I know the things that come into your mind, every one of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have multiplied your slain in this city, and you have filled the streets with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus says the Lord God: Your slain whom you have laid in the midst of it, they are the flesh and this city is the cauldron. But I will bring you out of the midst of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have feared the sword, so I will bring a sword upon you, says the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will bring you out of the midst of the city and deliver you into the hands of strangers and execute judgments against you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall fall by the sword. I will judge you in the border of Israel. Then you shall know that I am the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: This city shall not be your cauldron, nor shall you be the flesh in the midst of it, but I will judge you in the border of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus you shall know that I am the Lord. For you have not walked in My statutes, or executed My judgments, but have done after the customs of the nations all around you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now while I was prophesying, Pelatiah the son of Benaiah died. Then fell I down upon my face and cried out with a loud voice and said, “Ah, Lord God! Will You make a full end of the remnant of Israel?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Son of man, your brothers, your kindred, your fellow captives, and all the house of Israel, all of them, are they to whom the inhabitants of Jerusalem have said, “Go far from the Lord. This land has been given to us as a possession.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore say, Thus says the Lord God: Although I have cast them far off among the nations, and although I have scattered them among the countries, yet I will be a sanctuary to them for a little while in the countries where they have gone.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore say, Thus says the Lord God: I will gather you from the peoples and assemble you out of the countries where you have been scattered, and I will give you the land of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they come there, they shall take away all the detestable things and all the abominations from it.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will give them one heart, and I will put a new spirit within them. And I will take the stony heart out of their flesh, and give them a heart of flesh,
speaker: Narrator

text: that they may walk in My statutes, and keep My ordinances, and do them. And they shall be My people, and I will be their God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for those whose hearts walk after the hearts of their detestable things and their abominations, I will recompense their way upon their own heads, says the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the cherubim lifted up their wings with the wheels beside them. And the glory of the God of Israel was over them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The glory of the Lord went up from the midst of the city and stood on the mountain which is on the east side of the city.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Afterwards the Spirit took me up and brought me in a vision by the Spirit of God into Chaldea to those of the captivity.
So the vision that I had seen went up from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I spoke to those of the captivity all the things that the Lord had shown me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The word of the Lord also came to me, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Son of man, you dwell in the midst of a rebellious house, which has eyes to see but does not see, and ears to hear but does not hear. For they are a rebellious house.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, son of man, prepare baggage for captivity and go into captivity by day in their sight. And you shall go into captivity from your place to another place in their sight. It may be that they understand, though they are a rebellious house.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall bring out your belongings by day in their sight, as baggage for exile; and you shall go out at evening in their sight, as those who go into exile.
speaker: Narrator

text: Dig a hole through the wall in their sight, and go out thereby.
speaker: Narrator

text: In their sight you shall bear it on your shoulders and carry it out in the twilight. You shall cover your face so that you cannot see the land. For I have set you as a sign to the house of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: I did so as I was commanded. I brought out my baggage by day as baggage for captivity, and in the evening I dug through the wall with my own hands. I brought it out at twilight, carrying it on my shoulder in their sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the morning the word of the Lord came to me, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Son of man, has not the house of Israel, the rebellious house, said to you, “What are you doing?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Say to them, “Thus says the Lord God: This oracle concerns the prince in Jerusalem and all the house of Israel who are in it.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Say, “I am your sign.
“As I have done, so it shall be done to them. They shall go into exile, into captivity.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The prince who is among them shall bear his baggage on his shoulder in the twilight and go out. They shall dig through the wall to carry it out thereby. He shall cover his face so that he cannot see the land with his eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: My net also I will spread upon him, and he shall be taken in My snare. And I will bring him to Babylon to the land of the Chaldeans. Yet he shall not see it, though he shall die there.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will scatter toward every wind all who are about him, his helpers and all his troops. And I will draw out the sword after them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they shall know that I am the Lord when I scatter them among the nations and disperse them among the countries.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I will spare a few men of them from the sword, from famine, and from pestilence, so that they may declare all their abominations among the nations where they go and know that I am the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover the word of the Lord came to me, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Son of man, eat your bread with quaking, and drink your water with trembling and with anxiety.
speaker: Narrator

text: And say to the people of the land, Thus says the Lord God concerning the inhabitants of Jerusalem in the land of Israel: They shall eat their bread with carefulness and drink their water with astonishment, because their land shall be desolate from all that is in it, because of the violence of all those who dwell in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cities that are inhabited shall be laid waste, and the land shall be desolate. Then you shall know that I am the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The word of the Lord came to me, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Son of man, what is this proverb that you people have in the land of Israel, saying, “The days are prolonged, and every vision fails”?
speaker: Narrator

text: Tell them therefore, “Thus says the Lord God: I will make this proverb cease so that they shall no more use it as a proverb in Israel.” But say to them, The days are at hand and the effect of every vision.
speaker: Narrator

text: For there shall be no more any vain vision or flattering divination within the house of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I the Lord will speak, and the word that I speak shall come to pass. It shall be no more prolonged. For in your days, O rebellious house, I will say the word, and will perform it, says the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Son of man, look, the house of Israel says, “The vision that he sees is for many days to come, and he prophesies of the times that are far off.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore say to them, Thus says the Lord God: There shall none of My words be prolonged anymore, but the word which I have spoken shall be done, says the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Son of man, prophesy against the prophets of Israel who prophesy, and say to those who prophesy out of their own hearts, “Hear the word of the Lord!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus says the Lord God: Woe to the foolish prophets who follow their own spirit and have seen nothing!
speaker: Narrator

text: O Israel, your prophets are like the foxes in the ruins.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have not gone up into the gaps, nor did you build up the hedge for the house of Israel to stand in the battle on the day of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have seen vanity and lying divination, saying, “The Lord says,” when the Lord has not sent them. And they have made others to hope for the confirmation of their word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have you not seen a vain vision, and have you not spoken a lying divination when you say, “The Lord says,” yet it is not I who have spoken?
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus says the Lord God: Because you have spoken vanity and seen lies, therefore I am against you, says the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus My hand shall be against the prophets who see vanity and who divine lies. They shall not have a place in the council of My people, nor shall they be written in the register of the house of Israel, nor shall they enter into the land of Israel so that you may know that I am the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is surely because they have seduced My people, saying, “Peace,” when there was no peace. And when anyone builds up a wall, they daub it with whitewash.
speaker: Narrator

text: Say to those who daub it with whitewash that it shall fall. There shall be an overflowing shower, and you, O great hailstones, shall fall. And a stormy wind shall break it.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the wall has fallen, will you not be asked, “Where is the whitewash with which you have daubed it?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus says the Lord God: I will make a violent wind break out in My fury. And there shall be an overflowing shower in My anger, and hailstones in My fury to consume it.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I will break down the wall that you have daubed with whitewash, and bring it down to the ground so that its foundation is laid bare. And when it falls, you shall be consumed in its midst. And you shall know that I am the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus I will accomplish My wrath upon the wall and upon those who have daubed it with whitewash, and I will say to you, The wall is no more, nor those who daubed it,
speaker: Narrator

text: along with the prophets of Israel who prophesy concerning Jerusalem and who see visions of peace for her when there is no peace, says the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now you, son of man, set your face against the daughters of your people who prophesy out of their own heart and prophesy against them,
speaker: Narrator

text: and say, Thus says the Lord God: Woe to the women who sew magic bands on all wrists and make veils on the heads of persons of every stature to hunt souls! Will you hunt the souls of My people but save the souls alive of others for yourselves?
speaker: Narrator

text: And you pollute Me among My people for handfuls of barley and pieces of bread to slay the souls of those who should not die and to save the souls alive of those who should not live by your lying to My people who hear your lies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus says the Lord God: I am against your magic bands with which you hunt the souls there as birds, and I will tear them from your arms, and will let the souls go, even the souls that you hunt as birds.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your veils also I will tear off and deliver My people out of your hands, and they shall be no more in your hand to be hunted. And you shall know that I am the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because with lies you have made the heart of the righteous sad, whom I have not made sad, and strengthened the hands of the wicked that he should not turn from his wicked way and save his life,
speaker: Narrator

text: therefore you women shall no more see vanity or practice divinations, and I will deliver My people out of your hand. Thus you shall know that I am the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then some of the elders of Israel came to me and sat before me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The word of the Lord came to me, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Son of man, these men have set up their idols in their heart and put the stumbling block of their iniquity before their face. Should I be inquired of by them at all?
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore speak to them and say to them, Thus says the Lord God: Every man of the house of Israel who sets up his idols in his heart, and puts the stumbling block of his iniquity before his face, and comes to the prophet, I the Lord will answer him who comes according to the multitude of his idols,
speaker: Narrator

text: in order to seize the heart of the house of Israel who are estranged from Me through all their idols.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore say to the house of Israel, Thus says the Lord God: Repent and turn away from your idols and turn away your faces from all your abominations.
speaker: Narrator

text: For every one of the house of Israel or of the stranger who sojourns in Israel who separates himself from Me, and sets up his idols in his heart, and puts the stumbling block of his iniquity before his face, and comes to the prophet to inquire of Me for himself, I the Lord will answer him by Myself.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will set My face against that man and will make him a sign and a proverb, and I will cut him off from the midst of My people. And you shall know that I am the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if the prophet is deceived when he has spoken a word, I the Lord have deceived that prophet, and I will stretch out My hand against him and will destroy him from the midst of My people Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall bear the punishment of their iniquity. The punishment of the prophet shall be even as the punishment of him who seeks him
speaker: Narrator

text: in order that the house of Israel may no more go astray from Me or be polluted anymore with all their transgressions. Thus they shall be My people, and I shall be their God, says the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: The word of the Lord came to me again, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Son of man, when the land sins against Me by trespassing grievously, then I will stretch out My hand against it, and break the staff of the bread, and send famine against it, and cut off man and beast from it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even though these three men, Noah, Daniel, and Job, were in it, they could deliver but their own souls by their righteousness, says the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: If I cause wild beasts to pass through the land, and they destroy it so that it becomes desolate, that no man may pass through because of the beasts,
speaker: Narrator

text: though these three men were in it, as I live, says the Lord God, they could deliver neither their sons nor their daughters. They alone would be delivered, but the land would be desolate.
speaker: Narrator

text: Or if I bring a sword on that land, and say, “Let the sword go through the land and cut off man and beast from it,”
speaker: Narrator

text: though these three men were in it, as I live, says the Lord God, they would deliver neither their sons nor their daughters, but they alone would deliver themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: Or if I send a pestilence into that land and pour out My fury on it in blood to cut off from it man and beast,
speaker: Narrator

text: though Noah, Daniel, and Job were in it, as I live, says the Lord God, they would deliver neither their sons nor their daughters. They would deliver only their own souls by their righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus says the Lord God: How much more when I send My four sore judgments on Jerusalem, the sword, and the famine, and the wild beasts, and the pestilence, to cut off man and beast from it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet a remnant shall be left in it who shall be brought out, both sons and daughters. They shall come out to you, and you shall see their way and their deeds. Then you shall be comforted concerning the disaster that I have brought against Jerusalem, even concerning all that I have brought upon it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they shall comfort you when you see their ways and their deeds. And you shall know that I have not done without cause all that I have done in it, says the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Son of man, how is the wood of the vine tree better than any wood of a branch which is among the trees of the forest?
speaker: Narrator

text: Can wood be taken from it to do any work, or can men take a peg of it to hang any vessel on it?
speaker: Narrator

text: If it has been cast into the fire for fuel and the fire has devoured both ends of it and the middle of it is burned, is it useful for any work?
speaker: Narrator

text: When it was whole, it was not made into anything. How much less is it useful for any work when the fire has devoured it and it is burned!
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus says the Lord God: As the wood of the vine tree among the trees of the forest, which I have given to the fire for fuel, so I will give the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will set My face against them. Though they go out from one fire, yet the fire shall devour them. Then you shall know that I am the Lord when I set My face against them.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will make the land desolate, because they have committed a trespass, says the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Son of man, cause Jerusalem to know her abominations,
speaker: Narrator

text: and say, Thus says the Lord God to Jerusalem: Your birth and your nativity are from the land of Canaan. Your father was an Amorite, and your mother a Hittite.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for your birth, on the day you were born your navel cord was not cut, nor were you washed in water to cleanse you. You were not rubbed with salt, nor wrapped in swaddling cloths.
speaker: Narrator

text: No eye pitied you to do any of these to you, to have compassion on you. But you were cast out in the open field, to the loathing of your person, in the day that you were born.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I passed by you and saw you polluted in your own blood, I said to you when you were in your blood, “Live!” Indeed, I said to you when you were in your blood, “Live!”
speaker: Narrator

text: I have caused you to multiply as the bud of the field, and you have increased and become tall, and you have reached the age of fine ornaments. Your breasts were fashioned and your hair had grown, yet you were naked and bare.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when I passed by you and looked upon you, you were old enough for love. So I spread My garment over you and covered your nakedness. Indeed, I swore to you, and entered into a covenant with you, says the Lord God, and you became Mine.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I washed you with water. Indeed, I thoroughly washed away your blood from you, and I anointed you with oil.
speaker: Narrator

text: I clothed you also with embroidered work, and put sandals of porpoise skin on your feet, and girded you about with fine linen, and covered you with silk.
speaker: Narrator

text: I decked you also with ornaments, and put bracelets on your hands, and a chain on your neck.
speaker: Narrator

text: I put a jewel on your forehead, and earrings in your ears, and a beautiful crown on your head.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus you were decked with gold and silver. And your raiment was of fine linen, and silk, and embroidered work. You ate fine flour, and honey, and oil. And you were exceedingly beautiful and advanced to royalty.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then your renown went out among the nations for your beauty. For it was perfect through My comeliness which I had put upon you, says the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you trusted in your own beauty, and played the harlot because of your renown, and poured out your fornications on every willing passerby.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of your garments you took and decked your high places with various colors and played the harlot on them, which should never come about or happen.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have also taken your fair jewels made of My gold and My silver, which I had given you, and made for yourself images of men that you might commit harlotry with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you took your embroidered garments and covered them. And you have set My oil and My incense before them.
speaker: Narrator

text: My bread also which I gave you, fine flour, and oil, and honey, with which I fed you, you have even set before them for a sweet savor. And thus it was, says the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover you have taken your sons and your daughters, whom you have borne to Me, and these you have sacrificed to them to be devoured. Were your harlotries so small a matter?
speaker: Narrator

text: You have slain My children and delivered them up to idols by causing them to pass through the fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: Besides all your abominations and your harlotries you have not remembered the days of your youth when you were naked and bare and were polluted in your blood.
speaker: Narrator

text: After all your wickedness (Woe, woe to you! says the Lord God)
speaker: Narrator

text: you also built for yourself a shrine and have made yourself a high place in every street.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have built yourself a high place at the head of every street, and have made your beauty to be abhorred, and have spread your legs to every passerby to multiply your harlotries.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have also committed fornication with the Egyptians, your lustful neighbors, and increased your harlotries to provoke Me to anger.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I have stretched out My hand against you and have diminished your ordinary food and delivered you to the will of those who hate you, the daughters of the Philistines who are ashamed of your lewd conduct.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have played the harlot also with the Assyrians because you were insatiable. Indeed, you have played the harlot with them, and yet could not be satisfied.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have moreover multiplied your fornication with the land of merchants, Chaldea. And yet you were not satisfied even with this.
speaker: Narrator

text: How weak is your heart, says the Lord God, seeing you do all these things, the works of an imperious harlot.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you built your shrine at the head of every street and made your high place in every square, you have not been as a harlot in that you scorned payment.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have been as a wife who commits adultery, who takes strangers instead of her husband!
speaker: Narrator

text: Men give gifts to all harlots. But you give your gifts to all your lovers, and hire them that they may come to you on every side for your harlotry.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus you are different from other women in your harlotries in that no one follows you to commit harlotries, because you give money, and no money is given to you. Thus you are different.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, O harlot, hear the word of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus says the Lord God, Because your filthiness was poured out and your nakedness discovered through your harlotries with your lovers, and with all the idols of your abominations, and by the blood of your children, which you gave to idols,
speaker: Narrator

text: therefore I will gather all your lovers with whom you have taken pleasure and all those whom you have loved with all those whom you have hated. I will even gather them from all around against you and will reveal your nakedness to them so that they may see all your nakedness.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will judge you as women who commit adultery or shed blood are judged. And I will bring on you the blood of fury and jealousy.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will also give you into their hand, and they shall throw down your shrines, and shall break down your high places. They shall strip you also of your clothes, and shall take your fair jewels, and leave you naked and bare.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall also bring up a company against you, and they shall stone you with stones, and thrust you through with their swords.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall burn your houses with fire and execute judgments on you in the sight of many women. And I will cause you to cease from playing the harlot, and you also shall give no hire anymore.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I will make My fury toward you to rest, and My jealousy shall depart from you, and I will be quiet, and will be angry no more.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because you have not remembered the days of your youth, but have enraged Me in all these things, I also will recompense your way upon your head, says the Lord God, so that you shall not commit this lewdness above all your other abominations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Everyone who uses proverbs shall use this proverb against you, saying, “Like mother, like daughter.”
speaker: Narrator

text: You are your mother’s daughter who loathed her husband and her children. And you are the sister of your sisters who loathed their husbands and their children. Your mother was a Hittite, and your father an Amorite.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now your elder sister is Samaria, she and her daughters who dwell north of you. And your younger sister who dwells south of you is Sodom and her daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet you have not walked after their ways, or done according to their abominations. But, as if that were a very little thing, you were corrupted more than they in all your ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: As I live, says the Lord God, Sodom your sister has not done, she nor her daughters, as you and your daughters have done.
speaker: Narrator

text: This was the iniquity of your sister Sodom. Pride, abundance of bread, and careless ease was in her and in her daughters, but she did strengthen the hand of the poor and needy.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were haughty and committed abominations before Me. Therefore I took them away when I saw it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, Samaria did not commit half of your sins. But you have multiplied your abominations more than they and have made your sisters appear righteous in all your abominations which you have done.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also bear your own shame in that you have made judgment favorable to your sisters. Because of your sins that you have committed more abominable than they, they are more righteous than you. Indeed, be humiliated also and bear your shame in that you have made your sisters appear righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet I shall restore their captivity, the captivity of Sodom and her daughters, and the captivity of Samaria and her daughters, and along with them your own captivity,
speaker: Narrator

text: in order that you may bear your own shame and may be humiliated in all that you have done in that you are a comfort to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your sisters, Sodom and her daughters and Samaria and her daughters, shall return to their former state, and you and your daughters shall return to your former state.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the name of your sister Sodom was not mentioned by your mouth in the day of your pride,
speaker: Narrator

text: before your wickedness was uncovered, so now you have become the reproach of the daughters of Edom and all who are around her, the daughters of the Philistines, those all around who despise you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have borne the punishment of your lewdness and your abominations, says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus, says the Lord God, I will even deal with you as you have done, you who have despised the oath by breaking the covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless I will remember My covenant with you in the days of your youth, and I will establish an everlasting covenant with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you shall remember your ways and be ashamed when you receive your sisters, your elder and your younger. And I will give them to you as daughters, but not because of your covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus I will establish My covenant with you, and you shall know that I am the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: in order that you may remember, and be humiliated, and never open your mouth anymore because of your shame, when I am pacified toward you for all that you have done, says the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Son of man, put forth a riddle, and speak a parable to the house of Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: and say, Thus says the Lord God: A great eagle with great wings, long-winged, full of feathers which had various colors, came to Lebanon and took away the highest branch of the cedar.
speaker: Narrator

text: He cropped off the top of its young twigs and carried it into a land of merchants. He set it in a city of dealers.
speaker: Narrator

text: He took also some of the seed of the land and planted it in a fruitful field. He placed it by great waters and set it as a willow tree.
speaker: Narrator

text: It grew and became a spreading vine of low stature, whose branches turned toward him, and its roots were under it. So it became a vine, and brought forth branches, and shot forth sprigs.
speaker: Narrator

text: There was also another great eagle with great wings and many feathers. And this vine bent its roots toward him and shot forth its branches toward him, that he might water it by the bed where it was planted.
speaker: Narrator

text: It was planted in a good soil by many waters, that it might bring forth branches, and that it might bear fruit, that it might be a splendid vine.
speaker: Narrator

text: Say: Thus says the Lord God: Will it thrive? Will he not pull up its roots and cut off its fruit, so that it withers, so that all its spring leaves wither? It will not take a great power or many people to pull it from its roots.
speaker: Narrator

text: Though it has been planted, will it prosper? Shall it not utterly wither when the east wind hits it? It shall wither in the furrows where it grew.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover the word of the Lord came to me, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Say now to the rebellious house: Do you not know what these things mean? Tell them: The king of Babylon came to Jerusalem, and took its king and its officials, and led them to him in Babylon.
speaker: Narrator

text: He took one of the king’s seed, and made a covenant with him, and put him under oath. He has also taken away the mighty of the land,
speaker: Narrator

text: that the kingdom might be debased, that it might not lift itself up, but by the keeping of his covenant it might stand.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he rebelled against him in sending his ambassadors into Egypt, that they might give him horses and much people. Shall he prosper? Shall he escape who does such things? Can he indeed break the covenant and be delivered?
speaker: Narrator

text: As I live, says the Lord God, surely in the country of the king who made him king, whose oath he despised and whose covenant he broke, in the midst of Babylon he shall die.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nor shall Pharaoh with his mighty army and great company help him in the war by casting up mounts and building forts to cut off many persons.
speaker: Narrator

text: Seeing he despised the oath by breaking the covenant, when he had given his allegiance and has done all these things, he shall not escape.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus says the Lord God: As I live, surely My oath that he has despised and My covenant that he has broken, I will inflict upon his own head.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will spread My net upon him, and he shall be taken in My snare, and I will bring him to Babylon and will enter into judgment with him there for his trespass that he has trespassed against Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the choice men in all his troops shall fall by the sword, and those who remain shall be scattered toward all winds. And you shall know that I the Lord have spoken it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus says the Lord God: I will also take of the highest branch of the high cedar and set it aside. I will crop off from the top of its young twigs a tender one and will plant it on a high and lofty mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the mountain of the height of Israel I will plant it. And it shall bring forth boughs, and bear fruit, and be a splendid cedar. And under it all fowl of every wing shall nest. In the shadow of its branches they shall nest.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All the trees of the field shall know that I the Lord have brought down the high tree, have exalted the low tree, have dried up the green tree, and have made the dry tree to flourish.
I, the Lord, have spoken and will do it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The word of the Lord came to me again, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text:
What do you mean in using this proverb concerning the land of Israel, saying:
“The fathers have eaten sour grapes,
    and the children’s teeth are set on edge”?
speaker: Narrator

text: As I live, says the Lord God, you shall not have occasion anymore to use this proverb in Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: All souls are Mine. The soul of the father, so also the soul of the son is Mine. The soul who sins shall die.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But if a man is righteous
    and does that which is lawful and right,
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
has walked in My statutes,
    and has kept My judgments to deal truly,
he is righteous
    and shall surely live,
    says the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: If he begets a son who is a robber, a shedder of blood, and who does any of these things to a brother
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
has oppressed the poor and needy,
has devastated by violence,
has not restored the pledge,
and has lifted up his eyes to the idols,
has committed abomination,
speaker: Narrator

text:
has lent at interest, and has taken increase, shall he then live?
He shall not live. He has done all these abominations. He shall surely die. His blood shall be upon his own head.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now if he begets a son who sees all his father’s sins which he has done, and considering does not do likewise:
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
nor has he oppressed anyone,
    has not withheld a pledge,
nor has he devastated by violence,
    but has given his bread to the hungry,
    and has covered the naked with a garment;
speaker: Narrator

text:
he keeps his hand from the poor,
    has not received usury nor increase,
has executed My judgments, and has walked in My statutes.
He shall not die for the iniquity of his father; he shall surely live.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for his father, because he cruelly oppressed, devastated his brother by violence, and did that which is not good among his people, he shall die for his iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet you say, “Why should the son not bear the punishment of the iniquity of the father?” When the son has done what is lawful and right, and has kept all My statutes, and has done them, he shall surely live.
speaker: Narrator

text: The soul who sins shall die. The son shall not bear the punishment of the iniquity of the father, nor shall the father bear the punishment of the iniquity of the son. The righteousness of the righteous shall be upon himself, and the wickedness of the wicked shall be upon himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if the wicked turns from all his sins that he has committed, and keeps all My statutes, and does that which is lawful and right, he shall surely live. He shall not die.
speaker: Narrator

text: All his transgressions that he has committed, they shall not be remembered against him. Because of his righteousness that he has done, he shall live.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do I have any pleasure in the death of the wicked, says the Lord God, but rather that he should turn from his ways and live?
speaker: Narrator

text: But when a righteous man turns away from his righteousness, and commits iniquity, and does according to all the abominations that the wicked man does, shall he live? All his righteousness that he has done shall not be remembered for his trespass that he has committed and in his sin that he has done. In them he shall die.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet you say, “The way of the Lord is not right.” Hear now, O house of Israel. Is not My way right? Are not your ways not right?
speaker: Narrator

text: When a righteous man turns away from his righteousness and commits iniquity, he dies in it. For his iniquity that he has done he shall die.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again, when the wicked man turns away from his wickedness that he has committed and does that which is lawful and right, he shall save his soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because he considered and turned away from all his transgressions that he has committed, he shall surely live. He shall not die.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet the house of Israel says, “The way of the Lord is not right.” O house of Israel, are not My ways right? Are not your ways not right?
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I will judge you, O house of Israel, every one according to his ways, says the Lord God. Repent, and turn away from all your transgressions so that iniquity shall not be your ruin.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cast away from you all your transgressions whereby you have transgressed, and make yourselves a new heart and a new spirit. For why will you die, O house of Israel?
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have no pleasure in the death of anyone who dies, says the Lord God. Therefore, repent and live.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover take up a lamentation for the officials of Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and say:
What was your mother?
    A lioness among lions!
She lay down among young lions;
    she nourished her whelps.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When she brought up one of her whelps,
    he became a lion
and learned to catch his prey;
    he devoured men.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The nations also heard of him;
    he was taken in their pit,
and they brought him with chains
    to the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now when she saw as she had waited
    that her hope was lost,
then she took another of her whelps
    and made him a young lion.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He went up and down among the lions;
    he became a young lion,
and learned to catch the prey,
    and devoured men.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He destroyed their fortified palaces,
    and he laid waste their cities;
and the land and its fullness
    were appalled by the noise of his roaring.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then the nations set against him
    on every side from their provinces,
and spread their net over him;
    he was taken in their pit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They put him in a cage with hooks
    and brought him to the king of Babylon;
they brought him in hunting nets,
    so that his voice would be heard no more
    on the mountains of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your mother was like a vine in your vineyard,
    planted by the waters;
it was fruitful and full of branches
    by reason of many waters.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It had strong rods
    for the scepters of those who rule.
And its stature
    was exalted above the clouds,
so it appeared in its height
    with the multitude of its branches.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But it was plucked up in fury,
    it was cast down to the ground,
and the east wind dried up its fruit.
    Its strong rod was broken and it withered;
the fire consumed it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now it is planted in the wilderness,
    in a dry and thirsty ground.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Fire has gone out from its branch;
    it has devoured its shoots and fruit,
so that there is no strong rod in it,
    a scepter to rule.
This is a lamentation, and has become a lamentation.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the seventh year, in the fifth month, on the tenth day of the month, certain of the elders of Israel came to inquire of the Lord and sat before me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the word of the Lord came to me, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Son of man, speak to the elders of Israel, and say to them: Thus says the Lord God: Do you come to inquire of Me? As I live, says the Lord God, I will not be inquired of by you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Will you judge them, son of man, will you judge them? Cause them to know the abominations of their fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And say to them: Thus says the Lord God: On the day when I chose Israel, and lifted up My hand to the seed of the house of Jacob, and made Myself known to them in the land of Egypt, when I lifted up My hand to them, saying, I am the Lord your God,
speaker: Narrator

text: on that day that I lifted up My hand to them to bring them out of the land of Egypt into a land that I had selected for them, flowing with milk and honey, which is the glory of all lands,
speaker: Narrator

text: then I said to them: Cast away, each of you, the abominations of his eyes, and do not defile yourselves with the idols of Egypt. I am the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they rebelled against Me and would not listen to Me. They did not cast away the abominations of their eyes, nor did they forsake the idols of Egypt. Then I said I will pour out My fury upon them, to accomplish My anger against them in the midst of the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I acted for My name’s sake, that it should not be polluted before the nations among whom they were, in whose sight I made Myself known to them in bringing them out of the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I caused them to go forth out of the land of Egypt and brought them into the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: I gave them My statutes and showed them My judgments, which if a man does them, he shall live.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover I gave them My Sabbaths to be a sign between them and Me, that they might know that I am the Lord who sanctifies them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the house of Israel rebelled against Me in the wilderness. They did not walk in My statutes, and they despised My judgments, which if a man does them, he shall live. And My Sabbaths they greatly polluted. Then I said I would pour out My fury upon them in the wilderness to consume them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I acted for My name’s sake, that it should not be polluted before the nations in whose sight I brought them out.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also I lifted up My hand to them in the wilderness that I would not bring them into the land which I had given them, flowing with milk and honey, which is the glory of all lands,
speaker: Narrator

text: because they despised My judgments and did not walk in My statutes, but polluted My Sabbaths. For their hearts went after their idols.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless My eye spared them from destroying them, nor did I make an end of them in the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I said to their children in the wilderness: Do not walk in the statutes of your fathers, neither observe their judgments, nor defile yourselves with their idols.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am the Lord your God: Walk in My statutes, and keep My judgments, and do them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And hallow My Sabbaths. And they shall be a sign between Me and you that you may know that I am the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet the children rebelled against Me. They did not walk in My statutes, nor did they keep My judgments to do them, which if a man does them, he shall live. They polluted My Sabbaths. Then I said I would pour out My fury upon them to accomplish My anger against them in the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator
